page.title: 08THE CLEVELAND TONTINE
page.content: The Cleveland Tontine is an old coaching inn built in 1804 and stands at the junction of A.19 and A.172 G.R.444994.It has been converted into a hotel and restaurant and for the past 9years has been run by the McCoy brothers.They employ a full time staff of 16 and 5 part time to work in the two restaurants.The cellar restaurant is open for lunches and dinners and serves about 700 meals a week.The most popular dish is steak. In the upstairs restaurant 250 are served a week and white fish has become the most popular dish.Many celebraties have eaten there e.g.Roy Hattersley M.P.and Bucks Fizz,the pop group,as well as foreigners including Japanese for whom there is a special menu.There are also 7 bedrooms for guests.The Tontine is only closed on Xmas and Boxing day each year.
